title: Trump's tariff bomb on India: US issues notice to implement 50% 'sanctions'
content: The US has imposed a 50% tariff on most goods imported from India, citing India's indirect import of Russian oil and alleged threats to the US. This action, impacting sectors like textiles and seafood, exempts pharmaceuticals and electronics. Analysts predict a potential GDP reduction for India, although the impact is moderated by domestic consumption.

title: ED raids AAP leader Saurabh Bharadwaj, others in hospital construction 'scam'
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) conducted searches at AAP leader Saurabh Bhardwaj's residence and other locations concerning a money laundering investigation tied to an alleged hospital construction scam in Delhi. Bhardwaj, a former Delhi minister, is under scrutiny following an earlier case registered by the Anti-Corruption Branch (ACB). Simultaneous raids were carried out at 12 premises linked to the case.

title: 'We are a peace-loving nation, but ... ': CDS Chauhan's strong message
content: General Anil Chauhan emphasized India's commitment to peace while asserting the necessity of military preparedness, stating that peace without power is unattainable. He highlighted the blurring lines between war and peace, the importance of population resilience, and the evolving metrics of victory in modern conflicts.

title: Kerala temple row: Purification ritual at Guruvayoor; reels in pond trigger complaint
content: Guruvayur devaswom has ordered purification rituals at the temple after vlogger Jasmin Jaffar allegedly washed her feet in the temple pond and filmed reels, violating temple rules. The rituals, scheduled for Tuesday, will lead to restricted entry for devotees. Devaswom administrator filed a police complaint and will initially cover ritual expenses from devaswom funds, later pursuing legal action.

title: Trump’s 50% tariff on India from Aug 27: Why iPhone prices won’t rise
content: Despite President Trump's upcoming 50% tariff on Indian goods, Apple's iPhone exports from India to the US are expected to remain largely unaffected due to existing exemptions for semiconductor-powered devices. India now supplies a significant 71% of iPhones sold in the US, surpassing China. However, these exemptions are temporary, and future semiconductor levies could potentially impact Apple devices and pricing.

title: Mysuru lodge murder: Man kills lover with ‘controlled blast in her mouth’; face blown up
content: A 25-year-old man, Siddaraju, has been detained in Mysuru district for the murder of 20-year-old Darshitha in a lodge room. Police suspect Siddaraju, who knew Darshitha for seven years, killed her after she refused to marry him.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 near 24,800; Sensex down over 600 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, dropped in opening trade on Tuesday as US notified 50% tariffs on India effective tomorrow. While Nifty50 went below 24,800, BSE Sensex was down over 600 points.

title: ‘We count on India's contribution’: Zelenskyy thanks PM Modi for I-Day greetings
content: President Zelenskyy thanked Prime Minister Modi for his Independence Day wishes, expressing hope for India's role in ending the conflict through diplomacy. PM Modi reiterated India's commitment to peace and offered support for a peaceful resolution through dialogue. Both leaders emphasized strengthening bilateral ties, with Zelenskyy invited to visit India.

title: Apple CEO Tim Cook to employees: To not use AI would leave us behind; we can’t do that
content: Apple CEO Tim Cook has declared artificial intelligence as a pivotal opportunity, urging employees to integrate AI into their work. Despite a late start, Cook believes Apple can dominate the AI landscape, drawing parallels to past successes like the iPhone. The company is investing heavily, hiring 12,000 new employees and developing specialized AI infrastructure.

title: At 45, legend Venus holds back tears, discusses future - Watch
content: Venus Williams faced an emotional first-round defeat at the US Open against Karolina Muchova, casting doubt on her future in tennis. Despite a strong showing after a 16-month break, Williams lost in three sets. She expressed gratitude for the wild card entry and highlighted her improved physical condition compared to their previous encounter, emphasising her joy in playing pain-free.

title: Gold price prediction: Where are the rates headed on August 26 & the near-term
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are poised to increase as the US Federal Reserve considers rate cuts, influenced by Chairman Powell's focus on the job market. Geopolitical tensions, including US actions in Venezuela and Israeli strikes in Yemen, add to market uncertainty. Investors should monitor US tariff policies on India and upcoming economic data for further direction.

title: The last sortie: IAF chief flies MiG-21 into history
content: Ahead of their retirement after six decades of service, Air Chief Marshal A P Singh and other IAF officers flew MiG-21 sorties as a final farewell. ACM Singh praised the aircraft's agility but acknowledged its outdated technology and maintenance challenges. The formal farewell for the MiG-21s will be held in Chandigarh on Sept 26.

title: SpaceX prodigy exits: Kairan Quazi, hired by Elon Musk at 14, says ‘I felt ready’
content: Kairan Quazi, the 16-year-old former SpaceX engineer, is making a surprising move to Wall Street, joining Citadel Securities as a quantitative developer. He chose quant finance over AI labs due to its fast-paced environment and immediate impact. Quazi's unconventional path includes skipping grades and becoming SpaceX's youngest employee, now he's ready to tackle new challenges in the financial world.

title: ‘Strategic shock’: Donald Trump’s tariffs to hit 66% of India’s exports to US
content: Starting August 27, 2025, the US will impose 50% tariffs on $60.2 billion worth of Indian exports, impacting textiles, gems, and furniture. This move is projected to significantly reduce India's exports to the US, potentially benefiting countries like China and Vietnam.

title: Online Sports Bill impact: Dream11 CEO opens up - '95% of revenues disappeared..'
content: Dream11, facing a massive revenue hit after the passage of the Online Gaming Bill 2025, may discontinue its Indian cricket team title sponsorship despite a USD 44 million contract. CEO Harsh Jain confirmed a near-total revenue wipeout but assured no layoffs. The ban on real money gaming, while allowing social gaming, severely impacts Dream11's core business.

title: Raghav Gupta: INSEAD-trained exec appointed as OpenAI’s head of education initiatives in India
content: Raghav Gupta has been appointed as the head of education initiatives for India and the Asia Pacific at OpenAI. He will spearhead programs integrating AI into classrooms and collaborate with institutions like IIT Madras. Gupta's role includes overseeing research on AI's cognitive impact on students, leveraging his extensive experience to transform learning in the region.

title: Inside Tommy Fleetwood’s net worth and love story with wife who once rejected him
content: Tommy Fleetwood, a top-earning golfer with over $31 million from the PGA Tour and $35 million from the DP World Tour, owes much of his success to his wife, Clare. Despite a 23-year age difference and initial hesitations about mixing business with romance, Clare became Fleetwood's manager and life partner.

title: Syko Stu’s brother speaks after Raja Jackson attack, issues scam alert
content: Independent wrestler Syko Stu was brutally attacked by Raja Jackson at a KnokX Pro Wrestling Academy event, resulting in severe injuries and an LAPD investigation. Stu's brother, Andrew, has released a statement confirming Stu is in critical care and warning fans about fraudulent GoFundMe campaigns.

title: Cowboys’ Jerry Jones moves to block Micah Parsons trade
content: Despite a contract dispute and trade request from Micah Parsons, former NFL GM Doug Whaley believes the star pass rusher will remain with the Dallas Cowboys. Whaley points to past situations with Myles Garrett and T.J. Watt, where money ultimately resolved similar issues.

title: 'US not piggy bank or doormat': Trump fresh tariff threat for nations with digital taxes
content: US President Trump on Monday threatened trade measures against nations with digital taxes targeting American tech giants, deeming them discriminatory. He warned of tariffs and export restrictions on technology and chips if these policies persist. Dozens of countries impose digital services taxes, prompting debates over fair contributions from tech companies.

title: Pujara retires: Starc's wife makes a startling revelation - 'Last of a dying breed'
content: Alyssa Healy, captain of the Australian women's team and wife of Mitchell Starc, shared insights into the Australian men's cricket team's strategies against Cheteshwar Pujara, who recently retired. Pujara's remarkable defensive technique and endurance made him a formidable opponent, particularly in Australia, where he consistently wore down bowlers.

title: 'Addressing threats by Russia': US notifies India of additional tariffs; deadline tomorrow
content: The US has issued a notice to India regarding new tariffs set to take effect on August 27, 2025, in response to perceived threats from Russia, targeting India due to its economic ties with Moscow. Prime Minister Modi has vowed to protect Indian entrepreneurs and farmers from the impact of these tariffs, emphasizing self-reliance.

title: Aaron Rodgers already sidelined in Steelers’ plans as Mike Tomlin backs another QB
content: Aaron Rodgers' arrival in Pittsburgh is big news. But the Steelers' success depends on the whole team. Veterans and young players are key. Skylar Thompson's preseason performance shows the team's depth. Coach Mike Tomlin trusts proven players. The Steelers' season depends on coaching, health, and the team. Their gritty, team-first style will decide their playoff chances.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Recommendations for August 26- check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Mirae Asset Sharekhan's Somil Mehta recommends buying Sun Pharma and Bharti Airtel. Sun Pharma, exhibiting a breakout from a triangle pattern, is projected to rise, targeting Rs 1720. Bharti Airtel, forming a bullish flag, is expected to continue its uptrend, potentially reaching Rs 2045.

title: Revealed: When & where will Neeraj Chopra compete next? All you need to know
content: Neeraj Chopra is set to clash with Anderson Peters and Julian Weber at the Diamond League Final in Zurich on August 28. After securing fourth place qualification, Chopra aims for victory, having won the Doha and Paris legs earlier this year. He will also defend his world title at the World Championships in Tokyo next month.

title: Trade row: Trump says he could ‘destroy China’; hints at 200% tariffs on rare earths
content: President Trump asserted the U.S. holds significant leverage over China, hinting at the potential to severely damage their economy if necessary, during a meeting with South Korean President Lee Jae Myung. He mentioned ongoing trade disputes and recent conversations with President Xi Jinping, considering a trip to Beijing.

title: Another big exit! BCCI cuts ties with long-time team member
content: The BCCI has ended Rajeev Kumar's decade-long tenure as the Indian cricket team's masseur. Kumar, a beloved figure known for his dedication and trademark smile, confirmed his departure on Instagram. He was crucial in player recovery, providing massages, energy drinks, and on-field support. Players like Shami and Chahal have publicly acknowledged his vital contributions.

title: 100+ Happy Hartalika Teej wishes, messages, Images, greetings and quotes for 2025
content: Hartalika Teej, a festival celebrated with devotion in several Indian states, honors the divine union of Lord Shiva and Goddess Parvati. Women observe a fast, offering prayers for their husbands' well-being and family prosperity. The occasion is marked by exchanging heartfelt wishes and messages, fostering positivity and celebrating the enduring bonds of love and faith.

title: WNBA legend Candace Parker receives rare second jersey retirement honor
content: Candace Parker's jersey retired by Chicago Sky. She is second player with this honor from multiple teams. Parker played at Naperville Central High School. She led Sky to 2021 championship. Many Chicago icons attended the ceremony. Parker's influence extends beyond statistics. She won multiple awards. Sky coach called her a basketball savant. Parker is now a rising voice in broadcasting.

title: ‘Iconic Amul Girl created by daCunha, not influenced by Tharoor’
content: The iconic Amul Girl, a beloved mascot for decades, is at the center of a social media buzz after a viral video suggested she was inspired by Shobha Tharoor. However, Amul's marketers have clarified that the Amul Girl was created in 1966 by Sylvester daCunha and illustrator Eustace Fernandes, following the slogan 'Utterly Butterly Delicious'.

title: Fed shake-up: Trump fires Governor Lisa Cook; accuses her of ‘potentially criminal conduct’
content: Donald Trump ousted Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook, alleging mortgage fraud, a move contested legally. Cook denies wrongdoing, vowing to fight the dismissal. Experts question Trump's authority, citing the Fed's independence. This action, coupled with another vacancy, allows Trump to nominate loyalists, potentially impacting the Fed's credibility amid inflation concerns. The Justice Department is investigating the allegations against Cook.

title: Tyreek Hill hit with costly divorce update as ex-wife Keeta Vaccaro intensifies legal battle
content: Tyreek Hill, the Miami Dolphins wide receiver, is facing a costly divorce. He must pay Keeta Vaccaro monthly support and a lump sum. A judge blocked some of Vaccaro's requests. Hill still covers the mortgage and other expenses for her Miami condo. The legal battle continues as Hill prepares for the NFL season. The divorce proceedings are far from over.

title: Watch: Alcaraz’s new look shocks tennis world – Tiafoe says ‘it’s terrible!’
content: Carlos Alcaraz, aiming for his second US Open title, debuted a shaved head as he began his campaign against Reilly Opelka. Venus Williams is also set to mark her 25th appearance at the tournament. Alcaraz's new look drew reactions, including playful criticism from friend Frances Tiafoe, adding a lighthearted note to the competition's start.

title: Happy Onam 2025: Images, quotes, wishes, messages, cards, greetings, GIFs, and wallpapers
content: Onam, Kerala's cherished festival, is celebrated with vibrant traditions, commemorating King Mahabali's return. The ten-day festivities include floral decorations, feasts, and cultural events, fostering unity and joy. Onam 2025 emphasizes family, togetherness, and the blending of tradition with modern celebrations, offering a collection of greetings and wishes to enhance the festive spirit.

title: Gretzky’s last NHL game: From ‘awful’ night to dad’s push — why he almost played another year
content: Wayne Gretzky's last game was a grand event. But a quiet car ride with his father, Walter, meant more. Walter drove Wayne to Madison Square Garden. He kept urging Wayne to play another year. Walter's influence shaped Wayne's career. Family always came first. Walter's lessons continue to guide Wayne. He was more than a hockey legend.

title: 'Coolie' Box Office: Rajinikanth’s gangster drama sees major dip; crosses Rs 260 cr mark in India
content: Rajinikanth's 'Coolie' has crossed Rs 260 crore in India, despite a significant dip on its second Monday, Day 12. The action drama, directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, saw its weakest single-day collection but continues to lead over 'War 2' at the box office. The film's occupancy also decreased across languages after a strong opening week.

title: First human case of flesh-eating parasite detected; Symptoms, safety measures to follow
content: US health officials have confirmed the first human case of the New World screwworm in decades, detected in Maryland after the individual returned from El Salvador. While the risk to the general public remains low, this incident has prompted renewed prevention efforts.

title: Live tracking NFL cuts, trades and final roster moves around the league
content: We're following releases, trades, signings and other intriguing moves for all 32 NFL teams before the 4 p.m. ET roster cut-down deadline on Tuesday.

title: Browns send QB Pickett to Raiders for '26 pick
content: The Raiders acquired Kenny Pickett from the Browns on Monday, giving them an experienced backup for Geno Smith after Aidan O'Connell was injured, and leaving Cleveland with rookies Dillon Gabriel and Shedeur Sanders behind starter Joe Flacco.

title: Raleigh joins Mantle in record books with 50th HR
content: Cal Raleigh hit his 50th homer Monday night, extending his major league record and joining Mickey Mantle as the only switch-hitters to reach that mark.

title: Cards' Contreras ejected, hits own coach with bat
content: Following a called third strike in the seventh inning Monday, first baseman Willson Contreras threw a bat that mistakenly hit his own coach and tossed gum on the field after he was ejected in the St. Louis Cardinals' 7-6 win over the Pittsburgh Pirates.

title: Bengals give star DE Hendrickson big pay bump
content: The Bengals and Trey Hendrickson reached agreement Monday on a $14 million raise for this year, boosting his 2025 salary to $30 million, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Source: Veteran WR Cooper reunites with Raiders
content: Free agent wide receiver Amari Cooper is returning to the Raiders on a one-year contract, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: 'Dream come true': Clark a Nike signature athlete
content: Indiana Fever star Caitlin Clark, the 2024 No. 1 WNBA draft pick, was introduced Monday as Nike's newest signature athlete, which entails the launch of a new signature logo, a collection of sportswear and apparel -- and eventually a signature sneaker.

title: Halos' Washington had quadruple bypass, eyes '26
content: Angels manager Ron Washington said Monday he is recovering from quadruple bypass heart surgery and hopes to return to his position next season.

title: Venus shines in US Open return despite 3-set loss
content: Venus Williams, 45, played her first Grand Slam match in two years at the US Open on Monday, displaying some big serves and powerful groundstrokes before losing 6-3, 2-6, 6-1 to Karolina Muchova.

title: 💈Alcaraz's US Open haircut turns heads
content: When Alcaraz arrived at the US Open practice courts on Tuesday, his full head of hair was missing, replaced with a buzz cut.

title: Does Frances Tiafoe have momentum on his side at the US Open?
content: Tiafoe is playing at his favorite tournament -- in front of crowds that adore him. This might be the year he gets past the US Open semifinals.

title: Buzz: Standout players after the final preseason games
content: News and player observations from the final preseason weekend. Which players could get more opportunities?

title: Trey Hendrickson is latest Bengals star to get paid; now they have to win
content: Ja'Marr Chase, Tee Higgins and Hendrickson all landed new deals this offseason, and with that come expectations.

title: In Premier League classic, Ngumoha becomes talk of the town ahead of Isak
content: With the prematch talk focused on Newcastle's Alexander Isak, it was Rio Ngumoha, Liverpool's 16-year-old sensation, who stole the spotlight at St James' Park.

title: Is Gladbach the place to revive Gio Reyna's beleaguered career?
content: Five years ago, Gio Reyna was among the brightest prospects in soccer. Now, he just needs to play. Can he do that at Borussia Mönchengladbach?

title: Man City's No. 1 headache, Mbappé saves Real Madrid, Arsenal's depth on display, more
content: Tottenham's win at Man City exposed Pep Guardiola's goalkeeper headache, while Kylian Mbappe rescued Real Madrid as Xabi Alonso continues to tweak his team, as Marcotti recaps the weekend.

title: The VAR Review: Why Man United's goal wasn't ruled out; Trafford's red-card escape
content: Looking at why Manchester United were awarded a penalty at Fulham, but their goal was allowed to stand.

title: NBA predictions 2025-26: Biggest turnarounds, turbulence and questions this season
content: Which NBA teams will reach new heights and which will take a tumble? Which superstar will request a trade next? ESPN's Summer Forecast answers some of the biggest questions going into the 2025-26 season.

title: MLB predictions: What will Judge's WAR be? 61 homers for Raleigh? How many K's for Skubal?
content: Some players are on pace for incredible final numbers. We asked our MLB experts to decide who will keep it up -- and who will lose steam down the stretch run.

title: Where Raleigh's catcher HR record ranks among all-time surprising power seasons
content: The Mariners slugger made long ball history. Here's how his year stacks up with other shocking breakouts.

title: V of K-pop group BTS snaps photo with Shohei Ohtani, delivers Dodgers first pitch
content: V of K-pop sensation BTS threw a strike for the ceremonial first pitch before the Dodgers' game on Monday.

title: From the court to the villa: How Pepe Garcia found his way to 'Love Island'
content: The former Cal State Fullerton guard and international pro found himself back in the spotlight through "Love Island".

title: NHL draft prospect watch list: Who joins Gavin McKenna?
content: With the Hlinka-Gretzky Cup complete, draft season is here. Here are the top skaters to watch for next June.

title: The best 100 players in the NFL this season: Our experts' ranking, starting with four QBs in the top five
content: We predicted the top players in 2025. How many Eagles are ranked? Is Patrick Mahomes still No. 1? Where does Myles Garrett land?

title: Who were NFL Rank's 10 worst snubs? Scouts and execs ID the misses
content: Only 100 players can make the player rankings. Here are 10 more who league insiders felt should have been there.

title: What the world was like the last time an American man won the US Open
content: An American man hasn't won the US Open since 2003. From Beyoncé to Mars, here's what people were talking about when Andy Roddick hoisted the trophy.

title: Book excerpt: Does the future of college football need a commissioner?
content: On Sept. 2, "Forward Progress: The Definitive Guide to the Future of College Football" will be released.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Premier League clubs eye Man United's Mainoo
content: Manchester United midfielder Kobbie Mainoo would consider a move away from the club and others are keen. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Key issues to watch with one week to go in the transfer window
content: The transfer window closes on Sept. 1. Liverpool, Man United, Tottenham and Man City are all going to be busy.

title: 2025 boxing contenders: Who can win fighter of the year?
content: A look at the boxers who have the biggest chance to get the honors and how they can secure the award.

title: NFL betting guide: Four keys to help you navigate the 2025 season, plus early picks
content: Ben Solak looks at bets to take advantage of -- and ones to avoid -- and offers his strategy and early plays for the 2025 season.

title: Fantasy baseball pickups: Power, speed and a must-add returning ace
content: Here are the players you should claim off the waiver wire, including some pitchers returning from injury.

title: Trump Repeatedly Praises Kim Jong Un During Meet With South Korea President
content: In his first meeting with new South Korean President Lee Jae Myung at the Oval Office, Donald Trump brought up someone he claimed he knew "better than anybody," before adding "almost, other than his sister."

title: Probe Agency Raids AAP's Saurabh Bharadwaj In Hospital Construction 'Scam'
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) today conducted raids at Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leader Saurabh Bhardwaj's residence in the national capital for an alleged "scam" in constructing hospitals during his tenure as the Delhi health minister.

title: INS Udaygiri, Himgiri: The Indian Warships To Be Commissioned Today
content: The Indian Navy is set to commission two Nilgiri-class stealth guided-missile frigates - INS Udaygiri and INS Himgiri - simultaneously on August 26 at Vishakhapatnam.

title: "Hamas Began This War": Israel After Air Strike Kills 20 Civilians In Gaza
content: After Israel struck one of the main hospitals in the Gaza Strip, killing at least 20 people, the Israeli military said it doesn't "intentionally" target civilians, blaming the Palestinian group Hamas for creating "impossible conditions" through war.

title: Are You Aware Dowry Is Illegal? Nikki Bhati's Father's Chilling Response
content: Six decades after dowry was banned in India, a 28-year-old woman living less than an hour from national capital Delhi was burnt alive, allegedly by her husband and mother-in-law, over a demand of getting Rs 36 lakh from her parents as dowry.

title: "Show Respect Or Consider Consequences": Trump's Latest Tariff Threat
content: US President Donald Trump has threatened on Monday to impose "substantial" new tariffs to restrict American chip exports to all countries that impose digital services taxes and related regulations on US tech firms.

title: Hyderabad Rave Party Busted, 6 Arrested Including Businessmen, Homemaker
content: Six people, including three businessmen, a home maker, a software engineer and an engineering student, have been arrested after a rave party was busted in Kondapur, on the outskirts of Hyderabad.

title: "Won't Listen Anyone": Maratha Quota Activist Warns Ahead Of Mumbai Protest
content: Activist Manoj Jarange on Monday gave the Maharashtra government an August 26 ultimatum to grant a 10 per cent quota to the Maratha community under the OBC grouping, or face the wrath of protesters, drawing a sharp response from the BJP.

title: SpaceX Postpones Starship Launch Due To Bad Weather
content: Elon Musk's SpaceX postponed the latest test launch of its massive prototype Starship rocket on Monday because of bad weather, the company said on a live webcast.

title: PM Says Ahmedabad Has Emerged As Concert Economy, Recalls Coldplay Event
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that Ahmedabad is emerging as a major tourism hub and recalled that the recent Coldplay concert held in the city, which garnered global attention.

title: Maybe Americans "Like A Dictator", Says Trump Amid Washington Crackdown
content: US President Donald Trump on Monday suggested Americans would like a dictator as he signed orders to tighten his federal clampdown on the capital Washington and to prosecute flag-burners.

title: Trump Fires Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook Over Fraud Allegations
content: US President Donald Trump ordered the removal of Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook "effective immediately" on Monday, citing allegations of false statements on mortgage agreements -- expanding pressure on the independent central bank.

title: South Korean President Proposes Meeting Between Trump, Kim Jong Un This Year
content: South Korean President Lee Jae Myung has proposed a possible meeting between U.S. President Donald Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un later this year if Trump comes to South Korea for a regional forum meeting, Lee's office said.

title: "We Count On India's Contribution": Zelensky Thanks PM Modi For I-Day Wishes
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Tuesday thanked Prime Minister Narendra Modi for extending warm greetings on Ukraine's Independence Day.

title: Trump Says He "Will Step In Very Strongly" If Russia, Ukraine Skip Talks
content: US President Donald Trump on Monday warned of "great consequences" if Russian President Vladimir Putin and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy fail to hold talks, while asserting that the ongoing war would not have occurred under his leadership.

title: Trump Says Likely To Visit China This Year Or Soon After
content: US President Donald Trump said Monday that he expects to visit China this year or shortly afterwards, noting that economic ties between the two countries have improved -- even as he kept the door open to steeper tariffs.

title: 11 Pilgrims Killed, 40 Injured After Truck Hits Tractor-Trolley In Uttar Pradesh
content: Eight people were killed and 43 others injured when a truck rammed into a tractor-trolley carrying pilgrims in Uttar Pradesh's Bulandshahr district in the early hours of Monday, police said.

title: Trump Says He Wants To Meet North Korea's Kim Jong Un This Year
content: US President Donald Trump said Monday he hoped to meet again with North Korea's Kim Jong Un, possibly this year, as he held White House talks with South Korea's dovish new leader that got off awkwardly.

title: Video: Boulders Roll Down Hill, Hit Vehicles, Disrupt Road Link In Arunachal
content: A heavy landslide that occurred Monday afternoon near Sapper Camp, in West Kameng district, disrupted the road connectivity between Dirang and Tawang in Arunachal Pradesh.

title: 10 Dead, 41 Injured As Truck Hits Tractor Carrying Pilgrims in UP's Bulandshahr
content: Ten people were killed and 41 injured when a truck rammed into a tractor-trolley carrying pilgrims in Uttar Pradesh's Bulandshahr district in the early hours of Monday, police said.

title: Bhagwant Mann assures Stalin to consider implementing T.N. Chief Minister’s breakfast scheme in Punjab by August 27
content: The Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann hails his Tamil Nadu counterpart Mr. Stalin as people’s leader

title: Ukraine counts on India’s contribution to ending war with Russia: Zelenskyy
content: “Now, as the entire world strives to end this horrible war with dignity and lasting peace, we count on India’s contribution,” Mr. Zelenskyy said

title: West Bengal colleges face admission crisis as student numbers plummet
content: Delayed centralised portal and legal disputes over OBC list leave many undergraduate seats vacant, with students increasingly choosing other States

title: ED searches residences of AAP leader Saurabh Bharadwaj, others in Delhi
content: The ED searches are linked to alleged corruption in health infrastructure projects by the previous AAP government; Manish Sisodia slams the ED’s action as a bid to divert attention from row over PM Modi’s degree

title: U.S. issues draft notice to implement 50% tariffs on Indian products effective August 27
content: The draft notice, scheduled to be published on August 27, 2025, states that the Secretary of Homeland Security has determined it necessary to modify the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States (HTSUS) in line with the executive order

title: Bhagwat to outline RSS’ vision for future India at 3-day lecture series from today
content: The lecture series, part of RSS’s outreach programme for its centenary year, is expected to be attended by around 1,300 people.

title: Presidential Reference hearing LIVE: Supreme Court to continue hearing today
content: Centre had concluded its arguments by strongly advocating against imposing timelines on constitutional authorities like President and Governors; says the issue was better addressed in the political sphere than in the court

title: Over 1,000 women entrepreneurs from SHGs to be trained in capacity building
content: The programme aims to cover 100 Mahila Shakti Canteens; the training will be focused on financial and digital literacy, sales, marketing and retail management

title: What does the new online gaming Act outline? | Explained
content: What has the World Health Organization said about Real Money Games? How are e-sports and social gaming segments different from online money games? What are the penalties laid out in the Act with respect to engaging with online money games? Has the Supreme Court intervened?

title: Traffic diversions for Khairatabad Bada Ganesh darshan
content: Congestion can be expected at Khairatabad, Shadan College, Nirankari, Old PS Saifabad, Mint Compound and Necklace Rotary from August 27 to September 6

title: Content creator Atharva Sudame deletes video on social harmony after backlash
content: Mr. Sudame’s reel evoked mixed responses on social media as some spoke in favour of it while some others opposed it strongly, telling him to not give any advice on religious matters

title: ‘One Family, One Entrepreneur’ scheme empowers 1,000 women to take the driver’s seat in A.P.
content: MEPMA joined hands with Rapido in March to provide electric two-wheelers and three-wheelers to SHG women and their families

title: IIT Bombay researchers use microbes to unlock nature’s hidden rules
content: Subtle changes in food lead to divergent evolutionary paths, offering clues to predict future adaptations

title: North Odisha faces flood situation due to incessant rain
content: A fresh low pressure area has formed over Bay of Bengal which will trigger rain till August 29, says IMD

title: Police oppose conservancy workers’ plea to protest indefinitely
content: Say, the workers had lost a case against outsourcing of conservancy work and so they cannot indulge in protests instead of working out further legal remedy

title: Like bronze idols, India’s dino egg fossils risk being sold abroad
content: Around the world, fossils once bound for labs are now advertised in storefronts and auction houses. Ammonites, extinct sea creatures with coiled shells, once crowded ancient oceans. Today, their fossilised remains are sold on the streets of Paris. Larger, rarer specimens fetch staggering sums at auctions from private collectors

title: Rajasthan High Court stays order on panchayat elections
content: A Single Judge Bench had on August 18 ordered the State government to conduct the panchayat polls soon, after which the State Election Commission stated that it would shortly announce the dates

title: Calcutta High Court directs CID to investigate unnatural deaths at Purba Medinipur’s Khejuri, notes differences in autopsies
content: After two persons were found dead at Muharram event site this year, BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari had claimed that they were lynched for communal reasons, while the Trinamool Congress and the police maintained that the deaths were caused by an electrocution accident.

title: Supreme Court offers death row convict facility in jail to grieve virtually for his deceased mother
content: Bench rejects his plea to allow him to make the journey from a Surat jail to the “Naxalite” area of Buxar in Bihar to attend rituals

title: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar unveils projects worth ₹1056 crore for Patna Urban
content: The projects include ₹328.52 crore power modernisation and renovation of hostels of universities and colleges

title: Haryana Congress stages foot march against ‘vote theft’
content: Haryana Congress MLAs led by former Chief Minister and Congress leader Bhupinder Singh Hooda held a foot march to stage their protest as they carried placards and raised slogans against the ECI and the BJP

title: Technical, operational issues being resolved: SSC chief on ‘irregularities’ in recruitment exams
content: S. Gopalakrishnan says issues such as glitches in the computer-based tests and exams centres being far away from candidates’ residence are being resolved, and such disruptions are expected to be resolved from the upcoming Combined Graduate Level (CGL) examination

title: Tender minds being fed distorted history: Indian History Congress
content: IHC attacks NCERT's Partition modules, alleging that they spread “falsehoods with a clear communal intent”

title: Anamalai Tiger Reserve is home to 8 species of fireflies, finds study
content: The study was carried out by Advanced Institute for Wildlife Conservation, Vandalur, between April 2024 and March 2025. A. Udhayan, Principal Chief Conservator of Forests and Director of the institute, says this is the first study on fireflies in the State where genetic analysis was undertaken

title: Lack of diversity in Indian newsrooms a serious issue: N. Ram
content: Speaking at the inaugural of a residential workshop on journalism for students from rural, Scheduled Castes, and vulnerable communities, he says change will not happen by itself; it has to be enforced, and the State has to get involved

title: Government offers one-time switch from UPS to NPS
content: Around 31,555 Central government employees have opted for UPS till July 20, and the last date to enroll under the scheme is September 30

title: Supreme Court forms SIT to examine complaints against Vantara
content: A Bench of Justices was hearing two petitions, one filed by advocate Jaya Sukin, alleging unlawful accusation of animals from India and abroad, mistreatment of the animals in captivity, financial irregularities, money laundering, etc

title: ‘A.P. government focused on welfare, development of handloom and handicrafts sector’
content: Welfare schemes include the NTR Pension Bharosa under which government provides financial aide of ₹445 crore annually and ₹4,000 monthly assistance to 92,724 weavers in the State, says Handlooms and Handcrafts Development Honorary Advisor Suchitra Ella

title: Scrapping cotton import duty will push farmers into distress: Samyukt Kisan Morcha
content: “This move comes at a particularly bad time as farmers prepare to harvest their crop,” say SKM leaders

title: Air-drop test success a big step in Gaganyaan mission: ISRO scientist
content: The ISRO will follow up IADT-01 with the second Test Vehicle Mission (TV-D2) and the un-crewed Gaganyaan-1 (G1) flight, said Vikram Sarabhai Space Centre director Rajarajan

title: General Dwivedi holds defence talks with Algerian senior military leadership
content: General Dwivedi’s visit is expected to lay the groundwork for a long-term defence partnership, strengthening Army-to-Army cooperation and reinforcing shared principles of sovereignty, non-alignment, and South-South cooperation

title: Incarcerated MP Engineer Rashid’s supporters hold protest in New Delhi for his release
content: Demanding that the Baramulla MP be released, his supporters say jailing him ‘despite overwhelming public support is unjust and travesty of justice’. Arrested on ‘terror funding’ charges, Mr. Rashid is incarcerated for six years now. His Awami Ittehad Party calls for the release of ‘all innocents’

title: Expecting a timeline on J&K Statehood from SC, says CM Omar Abdullah
content: Abdullah’s statement came after the SC on Monday refused an urgent hearing on the J&K Statehood petition and instead listed the matter for October 10 this year

title: Kharge makes strong pitch to increase representation of women within Congress
content: The Congress chief urged party workers to take forward the campaign of ‘vote chori’ (vote theft) launched by Rahul Gandhi to the grassroots level across the country

title: CBI arrests four cyber frauds for duping foreign nationals
content: The agency arrested Arjun Prakash when he was about to board a flight to Kathmandu; three others were nabbed for running a call centre that hacked into bank accounts of the victims

title: Indian Navy to commission stealth frigates Udaygiri, Himgiri at Visakhapatnam
content: Both vessels are follow-on variants of the Shivalik-class frigates, featuring enhanced stealth capabilities, advanced weaponry, and modern sensor systems

title: Children are dying in clinics from starvation in Gaza: WFP’s Carl Skau
content: India is competent to address issue of hunger and nutritional insecurity, it is a food surplus country: WFP official

title: A decade on, kin of Fort Kochi boat tragedy victims continue wait for ‘promised’ jobs
content: While the government promptly paid the monetary compensation to the victims of MV Bharat accident, which claimed 11 lives, there is still no clarity on jobs ‘promised’ to dependents of the deceased; forum contests MLA’s claim on the issue

title: 130th Constitutional Amendment Bill to strengthen morality, good governance in politics: BJP
content: BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla says while the nation is welcoming the initiative, political parties such as the Congress and the Aam Aadmi Party are opposing it “only to protect corruption”

title: Stalin deputes two Ministers to take part in Global Ayyappa Sangamam
content: Minister for Hindu Religious & Charitable Endowments P.K. Sekarbabu and Minister for Information Technology and Digital Services Palanivel Thiaga Rajan would take part in the event

title: Bihar voters challenging deletions will get mandatory hearing, says Election Commission of India
content: A senior Election Commission official says that the Electoral Registration Officer will take a call on their inclusion on the final list or exclusion; to those excluded, the officer will issue a ‘speaking order’, stating the reasons for the decision

title: College teachers raise concern over declining enrolment in Science courses
content: The workshop, held to receive feedback for developing parameters for a proposed State Institutional Ranking Framework (SIRF), drew a flurry of comments from the participating faculty

title: Madras High Court appoints Special Investigation Team to probe kidney sale racket
content: The team will be headed by Inspector-General of Police (South Zone) Prem Anand Sinha. The court will monitor the probe. The team has been asked to submit a report on the progress of the probe

title: Retail prices of fruits, flowers and vegetables skyrocket despite lower rates in the wholesale market
content: There has been a vast difference in wholesale and retail prices of fruits, flowers, and vegetables on the eve of Gowri-Ganesha festival this year

title: Watch: Cheteshwar Pujara, India’s iconic Test batter, retires with 7195 runs, 19 centuries
content: From his debut in 2010 to his heroic performances in Australia, Pujara leaves behind a legacy of courage, triple-centuries in first-class cricket, and an unmatched role in India’s Test victories.

title: BBMP advances door-to-door garbage collection by an hour in Bengaluru
content: Official says the change will not only facilitate the residents to give their waste before leaving for work, but will also prevent the public from dumping waste everywhere and creating black spots

title: Nadendla launches Smart Rice Card distribution in Vijayawada
content: 4.42 crore cards, which ensure transparency in supply of ration through Fair Price Shops, will be distributed in nine districts initially, he says

title: RSS labour wing demands immediate implementation of wage and social security codes
content: The Bharatiya Mazdoor Sangh also demanded the withdrawal of the facial recognition system introduced by the Women and Child Welfare Ministry under its ICDS scheme

title: Security guard falls onto metro track at Ragigudda station, rescued safely
content: A BMRCL source told The Hindu that the guard had been on duty for nearly 16 hours with only a short rest before reporting back to work

title: No objection to Banu Mushtaq inaugurating Dasara festival if she respects deity, says Yaduveer
content: Yaduveer Krishnadatta Chamaraja Wadiyar, Mysuru MP, has said he has no objection to Booker Prize winner Banu Mushtaq inaugurating the Dasara festival if she respects the deity of Chamundeshwari

title: Kerala moves to revive Sabari Rail with push for land acquisition
content: State directs District Collectors of Kottayam, Idukki, and Ernakulam to begin acquiring the remaining land for the project.

title: Kerala makes blind spot mirrors mandatory on heavy vehicles
content: The move is aimed at enhancing overall road safety and reduce fatal accidents involving pedestrians, motorcyclists and pillion riders, who constitute a majority of all road accidents.

title: Woman found dead with mouth blown up in a lodge in Mysuru district
content: Police arrest woman’s boyfriend after mysterious death in Mysuru lodge, investigating possible explosive involvement in the incident

title: India alerts Pakistan about potential flood
content: Though Pakistan was informed, the Pakistan Foreign Office pointed out that the warning was communicated through diplomatic channels rather than the Indus Waters Commission

title: Delhi High Court directive to quash order on disclosing PM’s degree is ‘incomprehensible’, says Congress
content: The party’s response came after the Delhi High Court quashed a Central Information Commission (CIC) order directing disclosure of details related to Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s bachelor’s degree while holding it to be ‘personal information’ and ruling out any ‘implicit public interest’ in it

title: SIT continues questioning complainant in Dharmasthala case
content: The Belthangady police too continued questioning YouTuber Sameer in connection with three cases registered against him

title: Two industrial parks to generate 8,000 jobs in Kuppam soon, says official
content: ‘State government plans aim to boost rural economy and support livelihoods in Kuppam through new industrial initiatives’

title: Fantasy baseball news: Guerrero ready to return; Semien might be done for 2025
content: the fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around baseball . the schedule begins at 6:35 p.m. ET with the Baltimore Orioles hosting the Boston Red Sox .

title: Why Washington's offense is the big winner in Terry McLaurin's new deal
content: new: a former assistant coach says the deal needed to get done . new: the real money on the new deal won't be known until the three-year deal . the deal is expected to be announced on monday . it's unclear who won the contract extension .

title: NWSL Power Rankings: Orlando Pride are officially in a slump
content: alyssa Thompson scores for Angel City in the 86th minute to defeat Orlando 1-0 . the current continue to take care of business as far and away the league's hottest team . it's the 10th in a row without a loss for the league leaders .

title: MLS Power Rankings: Charlotte moves up, Miami slips down
content: the 2025 MLS season continues to chug along, which means it's time for ESPN's Power Rankings . our writers studied the action from across Matchday 28 to come up with this week's order of all 30 teams in the league . a revitalized LAFC and stolid Minnesota could be stumbling blocks to their dreams .

title: 10 pre-cut-down-day trade proposals that benefit both teams: Why these deals make sense
content: the league has entered its final flurry of trades before the start of the regular season . players who might be potential cut candidates or whose roster spots have been unexpectedly challenged during training camp are available . quarterback Sam Howell, running back Brian Robinson Jr., defensive tackle Harrison Phillips and wide receiver Skyy Moore are among the players who have changed teams for late-round picks .

title: Trump says Putin won’t meet Zelenskyy; eyes Kim meet, pushes Russia-China nuke talks

title: No free speech: SC raps influencers for mocking disability; Samay, Vipul among 5 to apologise
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Noida dowry case: CCTV 'shows husband outside house' at time of death
content: Advitya Bahl is a crime reporter with the Times of India's Noida edition . he has nearly a decade of experience covering both high and medium level criminal cases, court trials and police investigations . his work sheds light on systemic flaws in law enforcement and brings voices to the fore .

title: 'His kids were getting messed with at school': How Ryan Day handles the pressures at Ohio State
content: Ohio State coach Ryan Day leans back into the leather couch in his office days away from the showdown against top-ranked Texas . day took over for Urban Meyer in 2019 after just two seasons on his staff . only two other active college football head coaches have won national titles .
